questions.text: Among the following options, Pitolisant is used in treatment in which condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Narcolepsy Narcolepsy is a long-term neurological disorder that involves a decreased ability to regulate sleep-wake cycles. Symptoms often include periods of excessive daytime sleepiness and brief involuntary sleep episodes. About 70% of those affected also experience episodes of sudden loss of muscle strength, known as cataplexy.

Highyeild:

Pitolisant also called as tiprolisant ORPHAN drug It is a potent, orally active histamine H3 receptor antagonist/inverse agonist acts by blockade of histamine auto-receptors and enhances the activity of brain histaminergic neurons, a major arousal system with widespread projections to the whole brain used to treat narcolepsy with or without cataplexy

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Epilepsy is a group of non-communicable neurological disorders characterized by recurrent epileptic seizures. An epileptic seizure is the clinical manifestation of an abnormal, excessive, purposeless and synchronized electrical discharge in the brain cells called neurons. Option: B. Cataplex y is a sudden muscle weakness that occurs while a person is awake. Strong emotions trigger cataplexy. The triggering experiences are usually positive, like laughter, witty conversations, and pleasant surprise. Episodes may also be triggered by anger, but rarely by stress, fear, or physical exertion. Option: D. Anorexia nervosa is an eating disorder characterized by low weight, food restriction, body image disturbance, fear of gaining weight, and an overpowering desire to be thin. Anorexia is a term of Greek origin: an- (ἀν-, prefix denoting negation) and orexis ( "appetite"), translating literally to "a loss of appetite".

questions.text: Among the following triptans, longest acting triptan is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Frovatriptan rizatriptan is the fastest acting and frovatriptan is the longest-acting in the group Selective 5-HT1D/1B agonists (Triptans) This novel class of antimigraine drugs selectively activate 5-HT1D/1B receptors, and are called ‘triptans’. Currently, they are the first-line drugs for patients who fail to respond to analgesics. Ergot alkaloids are now required only in a few cases. Because these drugs have been designed to act on the same subtype of the 5-HT receptor, pharmacodynamic differences among them are minor, but there are significant pharmacokinetic differences.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B .Rizatriptan: is a medication used for the treatment of migraine headaches. It is taken by mouth. Common side effects include chest pain, dizziness, dry mouth, and tingling. Other side effects may include myocardial infarction, stroke, high blood pressure, serotonin Option: C. Sumatriptan belongs to a class of drugs called serotonin-1 receptor agonists. A class of drugs is a group of medications that work in a similar way. These drugs are often used to treat similar conditions. A migraine causes the blood vessels in the brain to expand. Option: D. Naratriptan: It relieves the symptoms of migraine and prevents the attack from becoming worse. This medicine helps by narrowing the blood vessels, thereby relieving the migraine headaches.

Extraedge:

All other triptans have higher oral bioavailability than the prototype drug sumatriptan. Fewer headache recurrences in an attack are reported with naratriptan and frovatriptan due to their longer t½, but they may be slower in affording initial pain relief.

questions.text: Which of the following drug is used in prophylaxis of migraine?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Flunarizine Flunarizine, Mechanism of action Flunarizine is a selective calcium antagonist with moderate other actions including antihistamine, serotonin receptor blocking and dopamine D2 blocking activity. Compared to other calcium channel blockers such as dihydropyridine derivatives, verapamil and diltiazem, flunarizine

Highyeild:

Flunarizine is a cerebro-selective T-type Ca2+ channel blocker used in the prophylaxis of migraine Flunarizine is a relatively weak Ca2+ channel blocker that inhibits Na+ channels as well. It is claimed to be as effective as propranolol. The frequency of attacks is often reduced, but the effect on intensity and duration of attacks is less well documented. It is claimed to be a cerebro-selective Ca2+ channel blocker, which may benefit migraine by reducing intracellular Ca2+ overload due to brain hypoxia and other causes. Side effects are sedation, constipation, dry mouth, hypotension, flushing, weight gain and rarely extrapyramidal symptoms.

questions.text: Among the following options, which drug is used for migraine prophylaxis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Erenumab Erenumab is a Mab against calcitonin gene-related peptide used for the preventive treatment of migraine in adults.

Highyeild:

Erenumab is the first FDA-approved CGRP inhibitor for the prevention of migraine in adults. ARISE study found fewer migraine days/month, and fewer days/month requiring migraine-specific medication for erenumab vs placebo. Statistical modeling study estimated 144 fewer migraine days/patient and >$8000 saved/patient over 10 yrs. Erenumab showed good safety and tolerability, which may encourage adherence in this population with high unmet needs.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. calcitonin gene-related peptide antagonists are Olcegepant and Telcagepant and are used for acute attacks of migraine Options: C, D. Sumatriptan and ergotamine are used for acute attacks

Extraedge:

CGRP antagonist A fully human monoclonal antibody Erenumab which blocks calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) receptor has been recently found to reduce the number of migraine attacks when injected s.c. once a month in patients with severe migraine

Table:

Proposed Role of Calcitonin Gene-Related Peptide (CGRP) Receptor Antagonists in Migraine CGRP is a potent neuropeptide expressed in the trigeminal system Increased during migraine and cluster headache CGRP receptor antagonists: May act at multiple sites to block the actions of CGRP Are not vasoconstrictors

Solution:

Methysergide Methysergide: is used for the prophylactic treatment of migraine and other vascular headaches. A serious complication of prolonged treatment is inflammatory fibrosis.

Highyeild:

Methysergide - Serotonin agonist, vasoconstrictor. Highly effective for primary treatment but has side effects on prolonged use (Retroperitoneal fibrosis, Pulmonary fibrosis) - Dose: 2 to 6 mg/day

Only minor side effects are seen with the triptans. Option: B. Ergotamine is an ergot alkaloid. Its use is restricted to patients having frequent, moderate migraine or infrequent, severe migraine attacks. The most common adverse effect seen is Gangrene due to vasoconstriction. Option: D. LSD, a potent hallucinogen acts as a 5HT receptor agonist/partial agonist and elicits sensory distortions (especially visual) and hallucinations. Hence, it is not used therapeutically.

questions.explanation:

Beta-adrenergic receptors Beta-adrenergic receptors: The adrenergic receptors or adrenoceptors are a class of G protein-coupled receptors that are targets of many catecholamines like norepinephrine (noradrenaline) and epinephrine (adrenaline) produced by the body, but also many medications like beta blockers, beta-2 (β 2 ) agonists and alpha-2 (α 2 ) agonists, which are used to treat high blood pressure and asthma. questions.text: A 29-year-old male came has been treated for an acute attack of migraine in the general medicine department. After that, he has prescribed an autoinjector with a drug that he should inject himself when a similar acute attack occurs in the future. Which drug will be present in the autoinjector?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sumatriptan Sumatriptan: is a medication used to treat migraine headaches and cluster headaches. It is taken orally, intranasally, or by subcutaneous injection. Therapeutic effects generally occur within three hours.

Highyeild:

Sumatriptan has a low oral bioavailability of about 15%. So, it should be given subcutaneously when an acute attack of migraine occurs. After SC injection, it reaches peak plasma concentration in about 12 min. An autoinjector with 6 mg of sumatriptan is available on the market which can be taken by the patients at the home itself if they get an acute attack of migraine.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B . Zolmitriptan is available as a nasal spray and oral formulation. Option: C. Naratriptan & D. Rizatriptan are available in oral formulations. Options: B, C, D. Not preferred in pregnancy as sufficient study of evidence of safety not conducted.
